Authors: Meiryani, Siagian P., Puspokusumo R.A.A.W., Lusianah
Title: Decision making and management information systems
Affiliations: Accounting Department, Faculty of Economics and Communication, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Accounting Department, Faculty of Economics and Communication, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Faculty of Economics and Communication, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Accounting Department, Faculty of Economics and Communication, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Authors with affiliations: Meiryani, Accounting Department, Faculty of Economics and Communication, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Siagian, P., Accounting Department, Faculty of Economics and Communication, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Puspokusumo, R.A.A.W., Faculty of Economics and Communication, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Lusianah, Accounting Department, Faculty of Economics and Communication, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Abstract: Management Information System is needed by public and private organizations. Management Information System is a system of support in making decisions taken by managers in overcoming problems that are happening in an organization both public and private organizations. Through MIS managers can make decisions wisely in the sense of being able to overcome the problems that are happening and the decision will not create greater problems that can disrupt the survival of an organization. the presence of computer technology has made a very positive contribution to the management information system and MIS is also very much needed by leaders in an organization or company for responsible decision making. © 2019 by Advance Scientific Research. This is an open-access article under the CC BY license (http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/4.0/)
Author Keywords: Accounting; Decision Making; Information Systems; Management Information Systems

Title: The role of management information systems in achieving excellent operational performance
Source title: International Journal of Scientific and Technology Research
Affiliations: Accounting Department, Faculty of Economics and Communication, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Authors with affiliations: Lusianah, Accounting Department, Faculty of Economics and Communication, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Meiryani, Accounting Department, Faculty of Economics and Communication, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Abstract: This article discusses the role of management information systems in achieving prime operational performance by focusing on the role of the enterprise system, supply chain management systems and customer relationship management systems.Management Information System (MIS) is important in improving the performance of employess. Management Information System is a system of human/machine unified (integrated) to present information that supports the functions of the operation, management and decision making within an organization. Management Information System is a set of indispensable information tool by small scale industries/small entrepreneurs to overcome the problems encountered. The method used in this paper is descriptive analysis, where the author begins with theoretical studies from various sources about Management Information Systems, enterprise systems, supply chain management systems and customer relationship management systems. then analyzed into the role of management information systems in the organization. © 2019.
Author Keywords: Achieving; Excellent operational performance; Management information systems; Role

Title: The influence of business process on accounting information system quality
Source title: Pertanika Journal of Social Sciences and Humanities
Affiliations: Accounting Department, Faculty of Economics and Communication, Bina Nusantara University, Jl. K. H. Syahdan No. 9, Kemanggisan / Palmerah, Jakarta Barat, 11480, Indonesia
Authors with affiliations: Meiryani, Accounting Department, Faculty of Economics and Communication, Bina Nusantara University, Jl. K. H. Syahdan No. 9, Kemanggisan / Palmerah, Jakarta Barat, 11480, Indonesia; Lusianah, Accounting Department, Faculty of Economics and Communication, Bina Nusantara University, Jl. K. H. Syahdan No. 9, Kemanggisan / Palmerah, Jakarta Barat, 11480, Indonesia
Abstract: Accounting information systems (AIS) is a tool to help a company's daily operations and assist management in decision-making. An integrated information system is usually used to achieve user satisfaction. Thus, AIS is used to improve the quality of improve the business processes of a company to improve its efficiency. The sample for this study was 61 state-owned enterprises and explanatory cross-sectional survey was conducted among the heads of accounting department, chief financial officer and the head (branch manager). Structural Equation Modelling (SEM) approach and Partial Least Square (PLS) were used to analyse data obtained. The results showed business processes affected the accounting information system. © Universiti Putra Malaysia Press.
